newsitem.title: LITHUANIA: LITHUANIAN UTENOS BREWERY TO DISCUSS CARLSBERG, BBH BIDS.
newsitem.headline: LITHUANIAN UTENOS BREWERY TO DISCUSS CARLSBERG, BBH BIDS.

text.p: Lithuania's Utenos Brewery said on Wednesday that its shareholders would discuss investment offers from Denmark's Carlsberg and Baltic Beverages Holding (BBH) next week.
BBH is a joint-venture between Finland's Hartwall and Norway's Orkla .

"Our shareholders will discuss these offers at a meeting on July 21," the brewery's general director, Stasys Krasauskas, told Reuters, confirming a report in the Wednesday edition of the business newspaper Verslo Zinios.
Carlsberg has offered to invest 81 million litas in the company, which has the biggest share of Lithuania's beer market, Krasuaskas said.
It also said it would pay 264 litas per share and would consider Utenos' contribution to the holding company to be 40 million litas.
BBH offered 50 million litas in investments and said it would pay 300 litas per share, he said. It would consider Utenos' contribution to the new holding company to be 50 million litas.
BBH has been active in the region and owns major breweries in each of the three Baltic countries.
